channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Double line marking on on the road needs to be repainted on Langford Place, 16th June
item.description:
Cars just leave their cars there as the feel it is a parking spot. People also leave their electric cars for charging
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Langford Place, St. John's Wood, London

item.title: In relation to: FixMyStreet ref: 7651834, 16th June
item.description:

item.title: Street Metal Traffic sign, 16th June
item.description:
There is a metal traffic sign placed in front of my shop, and it is causing several problems. People often bump into or brush past my shop window because of its position. The sign frequently falls over due to wind or other reasons, which creates a safety hazard. Additionally, it negatively affects the appearance of my shop and damages its image.”

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 95, Victoria Street, Victoria, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging trees encroaching pavement on Elmstead Lane by Grange Drive and BR7 5EG, 16th June
item.description:
The trees and shrubs are encroaching over the entire footpath making it difficult to walk past - almost now impossible with a push chair and virtually impassable with a double pushchair and also dangerous for students on their way to Babington School without having to walk in the road. This is along Elmstead Lane on the stretch of road opposite the junction at Wood Drive up to Grange Drive.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmstead Lane, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Furniture dumped in area, 16th June
item.description:
Has been dumped for months, including wooden pallets, chairs, door etc. No one has removed it. Cinema is not open to public since Aug 24 & residents in flats have not dumped the rubbish. Please could this be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Naval Walk, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Removal of abandoned cars, 16th June
item.description:
Cara have been abandoned for well over a year. Inside private parking estate. Resident pay all year round in order to park. These cars have not moved or seem to been out off road and have their tires flat or broken windows. Can we have them removed please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): John Ruskin Street, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bicycle has been dismantled and left, 16th June
item.description:
Months I also note that Adonis Supermarket dumps their rubbish at the tree next to the bike. This happens weekly and attracts further rubbish and vermin which creates a health a safety hazard

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41, Homerton High Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Vehicle, 16th June
item.description:
Received csc email 16/06/25 - Abandoned Vehicle Lat/Long - 51.3850556667633, 0.0397194921970367 what3words - chew.cake.comet Nearest address - Flat 1, 2 Archery Lane, Bromley, BR2 9FP Extra location information if given - Been sitting there for months all tyres flat
